questiontext.text: When you were first introduced to integration as the reverse of differentiation, the integrals you dealt with were indefinite integrals. The result of finding an indefinite integral is usually a function plus a constant of integration. In this Section we introduce definite integrals, so called because the result will be a definite answer, usually a number, with no constant of integration. Definite integrals have many applications, for example in finding areas bounded by curves, and finding volumes of solids.
